content:
XamlXmlReader Class

Definition

Processes XAML markup from XML files by using an XmlReader intermediary, and produces a XAML node stream.

In this Article

public class XamlXmlReader : System.Xaml.XamlReader, System.Xaml.IXamlLineInfo
Inheritance
Object
System.Xaml.XamlReader
XamlXmlReader

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()
Close()
Dispose(Boolean)
IsDisposed
ReadSubtree()
Skip()
IDisposable.Dispose()

Remarks

When you construct a XamlXmlReader, an XmlReader is required. The purpose of this design is to use established Microsoft .NET Framework APIs for XML processing in order to handle stream input, to obtain a stream from a file, and so on.

XmlReader is the first component of the standard load path for XAML operations and is incorporated by Load as well as by several existing framework XAML implementations for loading XAML.

Initializes a new instance of the XamlXmlReader class, based on a stream.

Properties

HasLineInfo

Gets a value that specifies whether line information is available.

public bool HasLineInfo { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if line information is available; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property is part of the IXamlLineInfo implementation. The result is partially based on the reader settings that were used to initialize this XamlXmlReader.

IsEof

Gets a value that reports whether the reader position in the XAML node stream is at end-of-file.

public override bool IsEof { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the position is at the conceptual end-of-file in the node stream; otherwise, false.

Remarks

If you are currently using a subtree reader, the subtree reader reports IsEof after exiting the bounds of the subtree. For more information, see ReadSubtree.

LineNumber

Gets the line number to report.

public int LineNumber { get; }
Value
Int32

The line number to report.

Remarks

This property is part of the IXamlLineInfo implementation. Node types of XamlNodeType, XamlNodeType, XamlNodeType, or XamlNodeType can return a line number. Other node types return a value of 0. All node types return 0 if HasLineInfo is false.

LinePosition

Gets the line position to report.

public int LinePosition { get; }
Value
Int32

The line position to report.

Remarks

This property is part of the IXamlLineInfo implementation. Node types of XamlNodeType, XamlNodeType, XamlNodeType, or XamlNodeType can return a line position. Other node types return a value of 0. All node types return 0 if HasLineInfo is false.

Member

Gets the current member at the reader position, if the current reader position is on a XamlNodeType.

public override System.Xaml.XamlMember Member { get; }
Value
XamlMember

The current member; or null, if the current reader position is not on a member.

Namespace

Gets the XAML namespace from the current node.

public override System.Xaml.NamespaceDeclaration Namespace { get; }
Value
NamespaceDeclaration

The XAML namespace from the current node, if it is available; otherwise, null.

Remarks

This property only has a non-null result if the NodeType of the current position is XamlNodeType. This property does not report the XAML namespace that applies to objects or members in a general scoping sense. Your implementation should cache XAML namespace information if you need it for specific operations. For default operations that involve the loaded XAML schema context, the acting XAML namespace is internally cached by XAML writer implementations.

NodeType

Gets the type of the current node.

public override System.Xaml.XamlNodeType NodeType { get; }
Value
XamlNodeType

A value of the XamlNodeType enumeration.

SchemaContext

Gets an object that provides schema information for the information set.

public override System.Xaml.XamlSchemaContext SchemaContext { get; }
Value
XamlSchemaContext

An object that provides schema information for the information set.

Remarks

This value is either the default XAML schema context or a specifically derived XAML schema context that is provided as constructor information. Schema context affects many aspects of XAML processing behavior. In particular, the SchemaContext of the reader is generally used by any associated writer.

Type

Gets the XamlType of the current node.

public override System.Xaml.XamlType Type { get; }
Value
XamlType

The XamlType of the current node; or null, if the position is not on an object.

Remarks

This property only has a non-null result if the NodeType of the current position is XamlNodeType.

Value

Gets the value of the current node.

public override object Value { get; }
Value
Object

The value of the current node; or null, if the position is not on a XamlNodeType node type.

Methods

Read()

Provides the next XAML node from the loaded source, if a XAML node is available.

public override bool Read ();
Returns
Boolean

true if a node is available; otherwise, false.

Remarks

A node where Read returns false also returns true for IsEof.

Calling Read generally has the side effect of advancing the LineNumber or LinePosition.

The next operation after calling Read and getting a true result is typically to check NodeType. For more information about XAML node stream concepts, see Understanding XAML Node Stream Structures and Concepts.
